title: Lorraine Kelly to be replaced by Christine Lampard and Helen Skelton on ITV show for three weeks
text:
Lorraine Kelly to be replaced by Christine Lampard and Helen Skelton on ITV show for three weeks The daytime host is going on a special trip to mark her 25th wedding anniversary Share Comments By Hayley Minn 00:01, 16 FEB 2017 TV Lorraine to be replaced by Helen Skelton and Christine Lampard Lorraine Kelly is being REPLACED by Helen Skelton and Christine Lampard on her own TV show Lorraine.
But, don’t worry, it’s only for two weeks while she takes a special trip to mark her 25th wedding anniversary.
Countryfile host Helen, who is also a published children’s author, presented the programme for a week last October and was an instant hit with Lorraine viewers.
Helen - who is pregnant with her second child - will present the programme for a week from Monday 20th February and it will be her last presenting role before she goes on maternity leave.
Read More Sir Cliff Richard opens up about shocking sex abuse allegations on Lorraine: 'I was on the floor in tears' Lorraine Kelly is being replaced on her own show (Photo: Rex Features) Helen Skelton will take the role for a week Christine Lampard will present for another two weeks (Photo: ITV) Helen said: “I can’t wait to be back on Lorraine, it’s such a great team to work with and I had a lot of fun presenting the show last time.”
The following week, Christine Lampard, who has most recently been anchoring Loose Women will step into Lorraine’s shoes to present the show for two weeks.
Christine said: “I’m excited to be fronting the show for a couple of weeks! I’m a huge fan of Lorraine and am flattered to have been asked to fill her shoes.
“I know there are some great guests coming up over the next few weeks and I’m looking forward to chatting to them too.”
Read More Nigel Owens reveals how 'overdose' suicide attempt over sexuality may have saved his life Lorraine will be off for three weeks going from South Atlantic to South Georgia (Photo: Rex Features) Meanwhile, Lorraine will be fulfilling a long held ambition by following the voyage, taken a century ago, by Polar explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton in the South Atlantic to South Georgia.
Lorraine said: “I’m so excited for what will definitely be a trip of a lifetime and I feel very reassured to know that the show is in such safe hands while I’m away.
“I’ll be keeping in touch from Antarctica throughout my journey and I look forward to sharing my adventure with Lorraine viewers when I get back!”
*Lorraine continues on ITV1, weekdays at 8.30am
